channel.title: Kaoto | Free and Open Source Integration Editor
channel.description: Recent content on Kaoto | Free and Open Source Integration Editor

item.title: Croway
item.description: Croway made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Step Extension API
item.description: You can extend Kaoto with custom views called Step Extensions.

item.title: Mohammadi Iram
item.description: Mohammadi Iram made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: No code deployment via Camel K
item.description: On the following video we can see how to do a no code integration and deploy it in a cluster via Camel K.

item.title: Selma
item.description: Selma made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Version 0.2.1 with bug fixes
item.description: This is a small patch bug fix adding a workaround for the Parameter polymorphism in https://github.

item.title: Evan Shortiss
item.description: Evan Shortiss made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Version 0.2.0 with improved editor!
item.description: What’s Changed Provide color syntax for Yaml textual editor #37 by @apupier in https://github.

item.title: Version 0.2.0 with improved editor!
item.description: What’s Changed Cluster deployment support (not available on frontend yet) in https://github.

item.title: Version 0.2.0 released with improved editor!
item.description: We have a new pre-release version v0.2.0 of Kaoto with a fancy refactored editor!

item.title: Hello World
item.description: On this video we can see we can drag and drop step into the integration and how to use the plus button to add intermediate and final steps.

item.title: Matej Melko
item.description: Matej Melko made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Kaoto Over Docker
item.description: There is a Docker Hub KaotoIO organization in which you can find all the docker images for both frontend and backend.

item.title: Almen Ng
item.description: Almen Ng made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Add a Custom View
item.description: Kaoto’s frontend is extendable, allowing you to create custom views. You can configure Kaoto to show a specific view instead of the generic form to configure properties in a step.

item.title: v0.1.0
item.description: What’s Changed This is the first release for the Kaoto backend.

item.title: Kaoto 0.1 is released!
item.description: The first version of Kaoto has been released. In this version, you can already edit a Kamelet Binding both visually and using the YAML editor.

item.title: Aurélien Pupier
item.description: Aurélien Pupier made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Zineb Bendhiba
item.description: Zineb Bendhiba made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: María Arias de Reyna Domínguez
item.description: María Arias de Reyna Domínguez made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Rachel Yordán
item.description: Rachel Yordán made their first commit on Kaoto!

item.title: Kaoto was born
item.description: Kaoto was born on a virtual coffee with Zineb , Rachel , and María .

item.title: Architecture
item.description: The architecture of Kaoto is designed to follow the Micro Frontends architectural style.

item.title: Add a New DSL
item.description: Kaoto’s frontend is agnostic of the DSL (Domain Specific Language) used, so to add support for a new DSL we just have to implement the specific endpoints on the API .
